title: Pastel de Tres Leches (Three Milk Cake) Recipe
description: Deliciously moist pastel de tres leches cake is soaked in a blend of heavy cream, condensed milk, and evaporated milk, then topped with whipped cream.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Latin American Mexican Pastel de Tres Leches (Three Milk Cake) 4.7 (122) 98 Reviews 32 Photos Pastel de tres leches is a sponge cake that's steeped in three kinds of milk: condensed, evaporated, and heavy cream. The soaked cake is served with whipped cream and sliced fresh strawberries. Store leftovers in the refrigerator. Submitted by Patty Valle Kafati Updated on November 4, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 32 32 32 32 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Additional Time: 1 hr 15 mins Total Time: 2 hrs Servings: 12 Yield: 1 10x15-inch cake Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings Cake: 6 medium eggs, separated 1 cup white sugar 1 cup all-purpose flour ½ cup milk 1 tablespoon baking powder 2 teaspoons vanilla extract Tres Leches: 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 (12 ounce) can evaporated milk 1 cup heavy whipping cream (Optional) For Serving: 1 cup whipped cream (Optional) 1 cup sliced fresh strawberries (Optional) Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10x15-inch baking dish. Make the cake: Beat egg whites in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on high speed until stiff peaks form. Gradually beat in sugar until mixture is glossy. Beat in egg yolks, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Reduce the speed to medium and mix in flour, about 1 tablespoon at a time. Mix in milk, baking powder, and vanilla. Pour batter into the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned on top and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool for 15 minutes. Make the tres leches: Combine condensed milk, evaporated milk, and cream in a blender. Pulse several times until well blended. Pour tres leches over cake. Cover and refrigerate until cake is cold and all liquid has been absorbed at least 1 hour. Cut chilled cake into 12 squares. Top each serving with a dollop of whipped cream and a few sliced strawberries. I Made It Print 279 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 396 Calories 19g Fat 48g Carbs 10g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 396 % Daily Value * Total Fat 19g 24% Saturated Fat 11g 55% Cholesterol 154mg 51% Sodium 244mg 11% Total Carbohydrate 48g 18% Dietary Fiber 1g 2% Total Sugars 39g Protein 10g 20% Vitamin C 10mg 11% Calcium 283mg 22% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 312mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Add Your Photo Photos of Pastel de Tres Leches (Three Milk Cake) 01 of 32 Photo by  Melissa Goff 02 of 32 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 04/25/2025 Family favorite Worth the effort A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser I’ve made this cake several times and it’s amazing every single time. Some reviews mention it being soggy or disappointing, but that really depends on how YOU prepare it. The type of pan matters, and I always pour the milk mixture slowly with a ladle. That way you can see how much the cake really needs—don’t just dump it all at once. Make sure to combine all three milks together first (evaporated milk, sweetened condensed milk, and heavy cream or milk). Slowly pour the mixture over the cake using a ladle, allowing it to absorb gradually. There shouldn’t be a thick layer of milk sitting on top — the cake should soak it up little by little.Perfectly moist, rich, and delicious. One of the best Tres Leches recipes out there!My Venezuelan friends couldn’t believe it when I served it—they said it tastes exactly like the one back home! This recipe is the real deal.The photo I attached is from my most recent creation. 03 of 32 Photo by  SpycGyrl 04/24/2025 OK with tweaks This is a really good Tres Leches cake that I have made many times. Yes, it's a 'wet cake' but it's supposed to be.Tips: If you don't want your cake to fall, only grease the bottom of your cake pan. Sponge-type cakes need to use the sides of the pan to "climb". The other suggestion is to add a tsp of vanilla to your milks. You can also use regular milk instead of whipping cream. I recommend it because this cake is rich enough. Poke holes all over the cake for better absorption. I use a chopstick or a kabob stick. There is no need to put your milk in a blender. Mix your 3 milks in a 4-cup or larger measuring cup for easy pouring onto your cake. Just whisk it well and whisk again before you pour onto your slightly warm cake. Once my cake is well chilled (overnight normally), I use a packet of powdered dream whip and a half tsp of vanilla, the milk it's whipped with, and spread it on the chilled cake. The packet has stabilizers that keep the topping from dissolving into the cake. Sliced strawberries on top are a perfect match. It will keep nicely for several days. 04 of 32 Photo by  Spacek 05/05/2021 Just a soggy cake! Yuck. Nothing like the picture. Very disappointed! 05 of 32 Photo by  Araceli 03/14/2021 06 of 32 Photo by  Stacey Tauschek 09/17/2020 07 of 32 Photo by  Stacey Tauschek 09/17/2020 08 of 32 Photo by  anita 05/20/2020 09 of 32 Photo by  Deb C 03/28/2020 It was a very moist cake, and I could have made an error when making it but I haven't a clue what that could have been. It was a very wet cake but very tasty. 10 of 32 Photo by  Jessica Valerio 02/26/2020 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love 3 Milk Cake or Tres Leches 49 Ratings G's Tres Leches Cake 53 Ratings White Tres Leches Cake 23 Ratings Tres Leches (Milk Cake) 1,847 Ratings Tres Leches Cake 395 Ratings Mexican Tres Leches Cake (Pastel de 3 Leches) 1 Rating How to Make Tres Leches Cake 78 Ratings Tres Leches Piña Colada Cake 61 Ratings Tres Leches Cake with Dulce de Leche 3 Ratings Tres Leches Cake (Three Milks Cake) 106 Ratings Margarita Cake with Key Lime Cream Cheese Frosting 101 Ratings Impossible Cake 107 Ratings Margarita Tube Cake 7 Ratings Eggnog Poke Cake (Tres Leches Style) 2 Ratings Mexican Chocolate Cake 109 Ratings Margarita Cake 416 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Patty Valle Kafati
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10x15-inch baking dish.;Make the cake: Beat egg whites in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on high speed until stiff peaks form. Gradually beat in sugar until mixture is glossy. Beat in egg yolks, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Reduce the speed to medium and mix in flour, about 1 tablespoon at a time. Mix in milk, baking powder, and vanilla. Pour batter into the prepared baking dish.;Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned on top and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool for 15 minutes.;Make the tres leches: Combine condensed milk, evaporated milk, and cream in a blender. Pulse several times until well blended.;Pour tres leches over cake. Cover and refrigerate until cake is cold and all liquid has been absorbed at least 1 hour.;Cut chilled cake into 12 squares. Top each serving with a dollop of whipped cream and a few sliced strawberries.
